@jma127 Probably for safety reasons, fiddling with .data is unsafe in many ways, e.g., here it keeps the object identity but changes the content completely.

Alternatively, a safer option can be done with named_parameters, i.e.,

def fn(m):
    for name, buffer in m.named_buffers(immediate_child=True):
        if isinstance(m, _BatchNorm) and (name == 'running_mean' or name == 'running_var'):
            m.name = buffer.float()
        else:
            m.name = buffer.half()
    ....

net.apply(fn)
